text: Vladimir Beara (; ; 26 August 1928 – 11 August 2014) was a Yugoslav football player, as goalkeeper, and also football manager. Beara played for Hajduk Split (1946–55) Beara played 308 games, and helped his team to win the Yugoslav league title in 1950, 1952 and 1955. Beara died in Split, Croatia, aged 85. ==Honours== Hajduk Split *Yugoslav First League: 1950, 1952, 1954–55 Red Star Belgrade *Yugoslav First League:1955–56, 1956–57, 1958–59, 1959–60 *Yugoslav Football Cup: 1957–58, 1958–59 Yugoslavia *Olympic Games: Silver Medal 1952 ==References== ==Other websites== *Vladimir Beara Profile at Reprezentacija.rs *Profile at weltfussball.de Category:1928 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Association football goalkeepers Category:Yugoslavian footballers Category:1952 Summer Olympics Category:First Vienna FC managers
